page.title: 04DENWICK VILLAGE
page.content: {Denwick }is a small village belonging entirely to {The Northumberland {Estates. }The shape of the village has remained unchanged since the earliest existing records and every effort is made to maintain its character. Any alterations must blend with existing buildings and any extensions must be to the rear of the properties.{ {Tenants,}who have all worked for the Duke at sometime,are not allowed to buy or alter their houses so there will always be control over the appearance of the village.{The Duke of {Northumberland }regards the village as part of a family,rents are low and the Estate is responsible for all repairs which can be reported at the{3 monthly {rent days }if they are not urgent. Tenants are not allowed to accommodate tourists but don't mind this restriction.
